com.acmol.risk

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.acmol.risk.GameController

  • public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller that handles the RISK game logic.
    Author:
    LASHERME Loic, FILAUDEAU Eloi, NANTIER Matthias, BOURSIER Louis

    • Method Detail

      • addPlayer

        public StringMessage addPlayer(java.lang.String playerId,
                               java.lang.String playerName)
        Used when a player join the server to play a game
        Parameters:
        playerId - the unique id that identifies a player, allocated by the server
        playerName - the player name, chosen by the player, and used for display
        Returns:
        a text message to information about the connection succes or failure

      • getPlayersName

        public StringMessage getPlayersName(java.lang.String playerId)
        Used for the clients to see the other player's name
        Parameters:
        playerId - unique player id
        Returns:
        a simple text message with the display name of all the players

      • launchGame

        public Message launchGame(java.lang.String playerId)
        Used when one of the connected client wanted to start a game
        Parameters:
        playerId - the player the triggered the game start
        Returns:
        a GameMessage with game data if the game started, a simple StringMessage with error information otherwise

      • findPlayerByNumber

        public Player findPlayerByNumber(int number)
        Search a Player by its game turn number
        Parameters:
        number - the player's turn number we are interested in
        Returns:
        null if no Player matches the number, the Player otherwise

      • initGame

        public Message initGame()
        Load game information about the continents and territories from a json configuration file
        Returns:
        a GameMessage with game data if the game started, a simple StringMessage with error information otherwise

      • askReinforce

        public Message askReinforce(java.lang.String playerId)
        Used when a client wants to know how many army unit are available for its reinforcement operation
        Parameters:
        playerId - the client id
        Returns:
        a GameMessage with game information and the number of unit available

      • reinforcementUnitAvailable

        public int reinforcementUnitAvailable(java.lang.String playerId)
        Internal method to compute the number of army unit available for a reinforcement operation
        Parameters:
        playerId - unique player id
        Returns:
        the number of unit available

      • finishTurn

        public Message finishTurn(java.lang.String playerId)
        When a player wants to finish its turn and let the next one play
        Parameters:
        playerId - unique player id
        Returns:
        a Message with the game context and information about the success or failure of the operation

      • putReinforce

        public Message putReinforce(java.lang.String playerId,
                            java.lang.String config)
        For a player reinforcement operation
        Parameters:
        playerId - unique player id
        config - text file to parse that contains the reinforcement operation information
        Returns:
        a Message with the game context and information about the success or failure of the operation

      • skipAttack

        public Message skipAttack(java.lang.String playerId)
        When a player wants to skip the attack operation. But attacks could have been done before
        Parameters:
        playerId - unique player id
        Returns:
        a Message with the game context and information about the success or failure of the operation

      • attack

        public Message attack(java.lang.String playerId,
                      java.lang.String config)
        When a player wants to perform an attack operation
        Parameters:
        playerId - unqiue player id
        config - text file to parse that contains the reinforcement operation information
        Returns:
        a Message with the game context and information about the success or failure of the operation

      • verifyOperation

        public Message verifyOperation(java.lang.String playerId,
                               java.lang.String action)
        Internal method to check if the client call on the endpoint is legitimate
        Parameters:
        playerId - played unique id
        action - a text to parse that contains information about the attack
        Returns:
        null if the operation is accepted, a Message describing the error otherwise

      • attack

        public boolean attack(Territory attackTerr,
                      Territory defenseTerr,
                      int unitInvolved)
        Internal method to compute if a player can perform a specific attack
        Parameters:
        attackTerr - the territory of the attacking player
        defenseTerr - the territory of the defensing player
        unitInvolved - the number of army unit the attacking player wants to use
        Returns:
        true if the attack is authorized, false otherwise

      • getPlayerTerritories

        public java.util.ArrayList<Territory> getPlayerTerritories(java.lang.String playerId)
        To know about a player's territories ownership
        Parameters:
        playerId - unique player id.
        Returns:
        the list of Territory a player owns. That is where it has at least one unit on it

      • winner

        public Player winner()
        To know the winner Player if there is one
        Returns:
        null if there is no winner yet, the winner Player otherwise

      • moveUnit

        public boolean moveUnit(java.lang.String idPlayer,
                        Territory territoryA,
                        Territory territoryB,
                        int unit)
        Check if a move operation is correct when a player wants to do the fortification operation
        Parameters:
        idPlayer - the unique player id
        territoryA - move from
        territoryB - move to
        unit - the number of army unit to move from A to B
        Returns:
        true if the move is accepted, false otherwise

      • foritfy

        public Message foritfy(java.lang.String playerId,
                       java.lang.String config)
        Use when a player wants to do the fortification operation
        Parameters:
        playerId - unique player id
        config - a text to parse that contains information about the fortification
        Returns:
        a Message with the game context and information about the success or failure of the operation

        Internal method that simulate a dice roll
        Returns:
